configureSources.title: Configuring content sources
configureSources.summary: Learn how to enable and configure the different content sources for your newsletter.
configureSources.content:
## Content Sources

Ghostarr can fetch content from multiple sources:

- **Tautulli**: Movies and TV shows recently added to your media server
- **ROMM**: Video games from your game library
- **Komga**: Comics and books
- **Audiobookshelf**: Audiobooks
- **Tunarr**: TV programming schedule

### Enabling sources

Toggle each source on or off using the switches. You can also use the "Enable all media" toggle to quickly enable or disable all sources.

### Max items

Set a limit on the number of items per source to control the newsletter length.

publicationModes.title: Publication modes
publicationModes.summary: Understand the different publication options: draft, publish, email, or email + publish.
publicationModes.content:
## Publication Modes

When generating a newsletter, you can choose how it will be published:

- **Draft**: Creates a draft post in Ghost. You can review and edit before publishing.
- **Publish**: Publishes the post immediately on your Ghost blog.
- **Email only**: Sends the newsletter by email to your subscribers without publishing it on the blog.
- **Email + Publish**: Both publishes the post and sends it by email to subscribers.

### Recommendation

Start with Draft mode to review your newsletters before publishing.

titleVariables.title: Newsletter title variables
titleVariables.summary: Available variables you can use in the newsletter title.
titleVariables.content:
## Title Variables

You can use dynamic variables in your newsletter title that will be replaced with actual values at generation time.

### Available variables

- `{{date.week}}` - Current week number (1-52)
- `{{date.year}}` - Current year (e.g., 2025)
- `{{date.month}}` - Current month number (1-12)
- `{{date.day}}` - Current day of month (1-31)

### Examples

- `Newsletter Week {{date.week}}` → "Newsletter Week 4"
- `Media Update {{date.week}}/{{date.year}}` → "Media Update 4/2025"
- `Weekly Digest - W{{date.week}} {{date.year}}` → "Weekly Digest - W4 2025"

### Usage

Simply type the variable in your title field. The variables work in both manual and scheduled generations.

preview.title: Preview before publishing
preview.summary: How to preview your newsletter before generating it.
preview.content:
## Newsletter Preview

Before generating your newsletter, you can preview what it will look like:

1. Configure all your options (sources, template, title, etc.)
2. Click the **Preview** button
3. A modal will open showing how your newsletter will appear
4. Check the content and layout
5. If satisfied, close the preview and click **Generate**

### Preview vs Final

The preview shows real data fetched from your sources. The final newsletter will be identical unless the source data changes.

createSchedule.title: Creating a schedule
createSchedule.summary: Step-by-step guide to setting up automatic newsletter generation.
createSchedule.content:
## Creating a Schedule

Automate your newsletter generation by creating schedules:

1. Click **Create schedule**
2. Enter a name (e.g., "Weekly Newsletter")
3. Choose the frequency (daily, weekly, or monthly)
4. Set the time and day (for weekly/monthly)
5. Configure the generation settings
6. Toggle **Active** to enable the schedule
7. Click **Save**

### Next runs

After saving, you'll see the next scheduled execution times.

cronExpressions.title: Advanced: CRON expressions
cronExpressions.summary: Use CRON expressions for complex scheduling patterns.
cronExpressions.content:
## CRON Expressions

For advanced scheduling, switch to **Advanced mode** and use CRON expressions:

### Format

`minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week`

### Examples

- `0 8 * * 1` - Every Monday at 8:00 AM
- `0 9 1 * *` - First day of each month at 9:00 AM
- `0 18 * * 5` - Every Friday at 6:00 PM
- `0 0 * * *` - Every day at midnight

### Tip

Use the simple mode for common patterns, and CRON only when needed.

manageSchedules.title: Managing schedules
manageSchedules.summary: Edit, pause, delete, or execute schedules manually.
manageSchedules.content:
## Managing Schedules

### Pause/Resume

Click the toggle switch to pause or resume a schedule without deleting it.

### Execute now

Click **Execute now** to run a scheduled generation immediately, regardless of its scheduled time.

### Edit

Click the edit button to modify the schedule settings.

### Delete

Click delete to permanently remove a schedule. This won't affect past generations.

uploadTemplate.title: Uploading templates
uploadTemplate.summary: How to import HTML templates for your newsletters.
uploadTemplate.content:
## Uploading Templates

Ghostarr uses HTML templates to render your newsletters.

### Supported formats

- Single HTML file (.html, .htm)
- ZIP archive containing HTML and assets

### How to upload

1. Click **Upload template**
2. Drag and drop your file or click to browse
3. Fill in the template name and description
4. Optionally set as default
5. Click **Save**

### Scan folder

You can also use **Scan folder** to automatically import all templates from the configured template directory.

customizeTemplate.title: Template variables
customizeTemplate.summary: Available variables and placeholders you can use in templates.
customizeTemplate.content:
## Template Variables

Templates can use various placeholders that will be replaced with actual content:

### Available variables

- `{{title}}` - Newsletter title
- `{{date}}` - Current date
- `{{movies}}` - List of movies
- `{{shows}}` - List of TV shows
- `{{games}}` - List of games
- `{{books}}` - List of comics/books
- `{{audiobooks}}` - List of audiobooks
- `{{tv_schedule}}` - TV programming
- `{{statistics}}` - Viewing statistics
- `{{maintenance}}` - Maintenance notice

presetConfig.title: Template presets
presetConfig.summary: Configure default generation settings for each template.
presetConfig.content:
## Template Presets

Each template can have its own default settings:

1. Click the menu button on a template card
2. Select **Default settings**
3. Configure the desired options
4. Click **Save**

### How presets work

When you select a template for generation, its preset settings are automatically loaded. You can still modify them for individual generations.

### Clear settings

Click **Clear settings** to remove the preset and use global defaults.

connectionIssues.title: Connection issues
connectionIssues.summary: Solving problems connecting to external services.
connectionIssues.content:
## Connection Issues

If you can't connect to a service:

### Check the basics

1. Verify the URL is correct and accessible
2. Make sure the API key is valid
3. Check if the service is running

### Common problems

- **Wrong URL format**: Don't include trailing slashes or API paths
- **Invalid API key**: Regenerate the key in the service settings
- **Network issues**: Ensure Ghostarr can reach the service (check firewalls)
- **SSL errors**: Make sure HTTPS is properly configured

### Test connection

Use the **Test** button to diagnose connection issues.

generationErrors.title: Generation errors
generationErrors.summary: Common causes and solutions for newsletter generation failures.
generationErrors.content:
## Generation Errors

### No content generated

If your newsletter is empty:
- Check that sources are enabled and configured
- Verify the date range includes recent content
- Make sure services are connected

### Template errors

- Ensure the template syntax is valid
- Check for missing required variables
- Verify the template file isn't corrupted

### Publishing errors

- Check Ghost connection
- Verify Ghost API permissions
- Check Ghost storage space

commonProblems.title: Common problems
commonProblems.content:
## Common Problems

### Images not showing

- Check that image URLs are accessible
- Verify CORS settings if using external images
- Ensure sufficient storage space

### Wrong timezone

- Configure the correct timezone in Settings > General
- Restart Ghostarr after changing timezone

### Missing translations

- Some content may not be available in all languages
- Check your language settings

### Slow generation

- Reduce the number of items per source
- Check service response times
- Consider network latency

configureServices.title: Configuring services
configureServices.summary: How to set up connections to Tautulli, Ghost, and other services.
configureServices.content:
## Configuring Services

Ghostarr integrates with several external services:

### Tautulli

1. Enter your Tautulli URL (e.g., http://localhost:8181)
2. Enter your API key (found in Tautulli Settings > Web Interface)
3. Click Test, then Save

### Ghost

1. Enter your Ghost admin URL
2. Create an integration in Ghost Admin > Settings > Integrations
3. Copy the Admin API key
4. Click Test, then Save

### Other services

Follow similar steps for ROMM, Komga, Audiobookshelf, and Tunarr.

apiKeys.title: Finding API keys
apiKeys.summary: Where to find API keys for each supported service.
apiKeys.content:
## Finding API Keys

### Tautulli

Settings > Web Interface > API Key

### Ghost

Settings > Integrations > Add custom integration > Admin API Key

### TMDB

Create an account at themoviedb.org and generate an API key in your account settings.

### ROMM

Settings > Security > API Key (or use username/password)

### Komga

Settings > Users > Select user > API Key

### Audiobookshelf

Settings > Users > Select user > Copy API Token

### Tunarr

No API key required, just the URL.

viewHistory.title: Viewing history
viewHistory.summary: How to browse and filter your newsletter generation history.
viewHistory.content:
## Viewing History

The history page shows all past newsletter generations:

### Columns

- **Date**: When the generation occurred
- **Type**: Manual or automatic
- **Template**: Which template was used
- **Status**: Success, failed, or cancelled
- **Duration**: How long it took
- **Items**: Number of items included

### Filtering

Use the filters to narrow down results:
- Filter by date range
- Filter by type (manual/automatic)
- Filter by status
- Filter by template

manageHistory.title: Managing history
manageHistory.summary: Delete entries, regenerate newsletters, or view on Ghost.
manageHistory.content:
## Managing History

### View on Ghost

Click the Ghost icon to open the published newsletter in Ghost.

### View details

Click the details button to see generation steps and configuration.

### Regenerate

Click regenerate to create a new newsletter with the same settings.

### Delete

You can delete entries from history only, or also delete the associated Ghost post.

### Bulk actions

Select multiple entries using checkboxes, then use bulk delete options.
